<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King a proclamation for all souldiers to repaire to their companies. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : M.DC.XXVII [1627, i.e. 1628]
Against loiterers in London. "Giuen at Our Court at White-Hall, the fiue and twentieth day of Ianuary, in the third yeere of Our Reigne of Great Britaine Scotland, France and Ireland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
=======

Against loiterers in London. "Giuen at Our Court at White-Hall, the fiue and twentieth day of Ianuary, in the third yeere of Our Reigne of Great Britaine Scotland, France and Ireland." Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
